divs: Sighting Details New Years eve 2009 appx. 12:10 am while lighting fireworks at midnight, a fireball streaked across the sky from west to east over south Bozeman,MT. It was at about 2000' AGL travelling at about 300 mph. It was completely silent and travelling level just below the clouds. Many people saw it, including several completely sober individuals as well as some young children. After about 30-40 seconds it disappeared into the clouds. My first thought was that it was a meteor, but it was travelling level at 2000', not decending, and much too slow to be a meteor. It was completely silent and had NO flashing aircraft-type lights on it at all. We all, including myself just watched it disappear into the clouds. I thought to myself, cool first contact!
trends: There have been 9 other sightings in Bozeman
There were no other sightings in Bozeman on or around January 1st 2009
